title: Gmail Inbox
description: Direct link to your Gmail inbox for accessing, reading, and managing emails. Useful for quickly jumping to your primary email interface.
notes: Use this URL to quickly open your Gmail inbox in a logged-in session. Not shareable unless the receiver has access to your account.

title: Git Hub
description: My GitHub profile where I store all my projects, code samples, and open-source experiments. This is also used for collaboration and version control.
notes: Tracking the code and pushing daily updates.

title: YouTube
description: The largest video-sharing platform where you can watch tutorials, tech reviews, documentaries, and coding walkthroughs. It’s a great tool for visual learning, entertainment, and following your favorite creators.
notes: Follow channels like Fireship, Web Dev Simplified, and Traversy Media for dev content.

title: ChatGPT
description: AI chatbot by OpenAI that helps with programming, writing, brainstorming, and much more. It's a powerful productivity assistant for developers, students, and creators.
notes: I use it daily for debugging, project ideas, and learning new tech fast.

title: Google Maps
description: Use Google Maps for navigation, traffic info, and discovering nearby places like restaurants, gas stations, and ATMs. It offers satellite views, real-time directions, and saved locations.
notes: Use 'Your Places' to pin locations I visit often or want to remember.

title: Vercel
description: Vercel is a cloud platform for hosting front-end frameworks and static sites, especially optimized for React, Next.js, Vue, and Svelte. Offers instant deployments, GitHub integration, serverless functions, analytics, and custom domains.
notes: I use it to instantly deploy all my React and Vite projects. Super fast with GitHub integration!

title: Netlify
description: Netlify is a powerful cloud hosting platform for static websites and JAMstack apps. It supports continuous deployment from Git, custom domains, serverless functions, form handling, and edge functions — all with a simple developer-friendly workflow.
notes: I use Netlify for quick deploys of HTML, JS, and Tailwind projects. Built-in form support is super handy!

title: SVGRepo
description: A massive free library of over 500,000 SVG vector icons and illustrations. Great for designers, developers, and UI creators looking for clean and customizable graphics. All icons are available in multiple styles and formats.
notes: Use for downloading high-quality SVG icons and illustrations. Supports searching by keyword and style.

title: Formspree Contact API
description: Formspree provides a simple way to handle form submissions for static sites. This specific page contains the API integration details for the contact form used in my blog and portfolio project.
notes: Use this link when configuring contact form integration in React projects using Formspree's POST endpoint.

title: MongoDB Atlas Cluster
description: MongoDB Atlas is a fully managed cloud database service for MongoDB. This link leads to the cluster dashboard where I manage databases, monitor performance, connect my apps securely, and handle backup and scaling configurations.
notes: Use this to manage cluster connections and access credentials for full-stack projects using MongoDB.

title: Cohere API Keys Dashboard
description: This page allows you to generate and manage API keys for accessing Cohere's NLP services. Required for integrating Cohere into your React/Node projects.
notes: Use this page to copy your API key and integrate it securely in your backend when calling Cohere endpoints.

title: WeatherAPI Key Dashboard
description: This page provides access to your API key and usage stats for WeatherAPI.com, a service used to fetch real-time weather data in web and mobile apps.
notes: Use this page to get your WeatherAPI key and track quota usage. Ideal for weather apps built with React and Node.

title: Weather App (Vercel)
description: A simple and responsive weather application built using React, Tailwind CSS, and WeatherAPI.com. It displays current weather details for any city entered by the user.
notes: Deployed on Vercel. This app fetches real-time weather data using the WeatherAPI.com key and provides a user-friendly UI with Lucide icons and Framer Motion animations.
